artist: Designer: Arne Jacobsen; Manufacturer: Fritz Hansen
creditline: Anonymous gift in honor of Yvonne Brunhammer
description: bent plywood seat and backrest; rounded seat with rounded backrest--one piece of plywood; three metal legs--two in back, one in front; medium wood finish
image_copyright: © Fritz Hansen %2F The Ant%E2%84%A2%2C Arne Jacobsen
markings: on bottom at center, stamped in metal: [FH (inside a circle) / DANMARK]; on bottom, stenciled in white: [FH (inside a circle) / (illegible)]
text: Arne Jacobsen’s Ant chair is an insect-inspired take on molded plywood furniture. The one-piece plywood form is bent below its “waist” (or, in insect terms, between thorax and abdomen), allowing for flexibility and better comfort in a simple, lightweight, stackable chair with a pleasing organic form. This three-legged version was the first iteration of the Ant—though it was perfectly stable, it was upgraded to four legs in the second version.
title: Ant chair
